p.s: The limits of my language are the limits of my world is a quote by Ludwig Wittgenstein, which I am going to comment on.
Especially in a globalized world, being multilingual is essetial.
Jobs, media, everyday language - other languages, especially English, are ever-present.
If you only speak your native language, you might get left behind in the modern world.
A good example of that is one of my family members complaining about not being able to read commercials because they contain English words.
This might not be a huge problem, but it shows how big of a role other languages play in our lives nontheless.
In conclusion: I agree with Wittgenstein.
Especially nowadays, not knowing other languages really does limit your horizon, even if you do not want to travel.
Other cultures and languages are a part of ours.
